Innovation is the lifeblood of progress in any industry, and agriculture is no exception. Organizations worldwide are rethinking traditional agricultural practices to enhance sustainability and secure food for everyone. We're thrilled to highlight some of our forward-thinking customers and research partners making significant strides in agricultural innovation: üå± Bayer Mexico is advancing water conservation in agriculture with CARLOTA, a tech-driven service that utilizes our technology to give growers access to critical in-field intelligence, helping them minimize their water footprint and irrigation costs. üå± The Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation (Embrapa), one of our valued Cal/Val partners, is committed to research, development, and innovation to sustain agriculture and benefit Brazilian society. üå± EMILI, an industry-led non-profit in Canada, provides access to cutting-edge equipment and technology to promote farmer-centric innovation, advance sustainable techniques, and increase digital agriculture skills and knowledge. üå± KSU-TAPS is fostering farming innovation through a collaborative ecosystem that encourages the use of technology to push the boundaries of agricultural crop profitability in a limited-water environment. üå± Tomorrownow is leveraging our technology to provide smallholder farmers in Africa with localized weather insights, aiding their adaptation to climate change. Join us in celebrating these trailblazers who are reshaping the future of agriculture! Bayer Embrapa EMILI #KStateResearch #KSUTAPS TomorrowNow.org #agtech #sustainablefarming #aginnovation #smartfarming

I am continually amazed by the level of innovation I've experienced at The Garage East Africa. Recently, we showcased five incredible working prototypes to various industry stakeholders. Here are some highlights that will blow your mind when you visit: 1. Alfred the Bot - An AI bot infused with ChatGPT, built by our talented engineers led by Meshack Musundi, Bryson Yida, and Aymen Mohammed. Alfred speaks with an African accent and answers all the questions you would expect from ChatGPT. 2.The Garage Wheel of the Future - Spin this wheel to see how various cities in Kenya will look hundreds of years from today. This artistic marvel was created by software engineers Wambui Kaburi, Kennedy Kahiri, Leah Ligare, Felix O., among others. 3. Forest Guard - A project initiated by four interns, now employees, to combat deforestation. Kudos to David L. , Gloria Keya, Audrey Njenga, and Christine W.. for their dedication. 4. Agri Advisor Project - A conversational AI agent that provides farmers with agronomic advice. This was a collaborative effort with Tomorrow Now, featuring Ronald Diang‚Äôa, Kenneth Chepkwony, and an exceptional team from Microsoft ADC, including Tina Murimi, Felix Kwizera 5. A Working Iron Man Helmet - An IoT project led by Gurupreet Dhanjal, Sean Wasonga and a team of enthusiastic software engineers, bringing fiction to reality. These are just a few of the remarkable projects created in Kenya through the outstanding craftsmanship at the Microsoft Africa Development Center. Visit The Garage and get inspired. As we gear up for the global hackathon, I am excited to see even more groundbreaking innovations emerging from Kenya to the world. Ady Mor-Biran Catherine Muraga Tabbz Maina Ademola Odusanya, SCP Irene Githinji Jeff Ramos
